item.title: New Elden Ring Art Book Focuses On Shadow Of The Erdtree
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The third volume in Udon Entertainment's official Elden Ring art book series is launching on November 4, and this new entry is all about the Shadow of the Erdtree expansion. Shadow of the Erdtree added multiple massive new open world locations, dungeons, and dozens of bosses to the already enormous action RPG--enough content that it could have easily been its own standalone game--so it's no surprise that the expansion is getting its own dedicated art book.

If you're looking to add it to your collection, you can preorder Elden Ring: Official Art Book Volume III at Amazon now. Preorders are even slightly discounted to just $55.79, saving you a few dollars off its $60 launch price. And thanks to Amazon's preorder price guarantee, if that drops any further, you'll only pay the lowest price once your order ships.

We've detailed the new art book below, and included information about the previous two volumes as well in case you're curious about the full series. Unfortunately, Volume I is currently sold out, but Volume II is still available at Amazon and is even discounted to just $42.73 (was $60) at the time of writing.

Elden Ring Official Art Books

  • Elden Ring: Official Art Book Volume I -- Sold Out (As of July 28)
  • Elden Ring: Official Art Book Volume II -- $42.73 ($60)
  • Elden Ring: Official Art Book Volume III --$55.79 ($60) | Releases November 4

Elden Ring: Official Art Book Volume III

$55.79 (was $60) | Releases November 4

This 320-page hardcover art book is a fitting size given how much content Shadow of the Erdtree added to Elden Ring. The book compiles hundreds of pieces of concept art and illustrations of the expansion's numerous new locations from the Realm of Shadow, as well as the various bosses, creatures, characters, weapons, and armor sets that players encounter there. Along with the art, the book also features newly translated development commentary and lore.

Elden Ring: Official Art Book Volume I

$60 MSRP | Sold Out

The previous two books in the Elden Ring: Official Art Book series focus on different aspects of From Software's giant dark fantasy epic. The first volume is the biggest of the three, clocking in at 432 pages, and includes art and behind-the-scenes information on the game's sprawling open world zone and dungeons.

Unfortunately, Volume I is currently out of stock, but we expect a new printing could drop in the future given how popular the book is. The book has already been reprinted on multiple occasions since its 2023 release, so keep an eye on the Amazon store page to see if it's back in stock.

Elden Ring: Official Art Book Volume II

$42.73 (was $60)

Elden Ring: Official Art Book Volume II is a 384-page hardcover tome that covers the many denizens of Elden Ring's setting, the Lands Between. The book is packed with art and lore on the monsters, bosses, and characters who call the cursed world home, as well as many of the deadly weapons and mysterious items players collect on their adventures. Volume II is currently in stock and available for $42.73 at Amazon (was $60).

Elden Ring Official Strategy Guides

The Elden Ring: Official Art Book Volume III isn't the only new Elden Ring guide book launching later this year. The official companion guide for the recently released Elden Ring spin-off, Elden Ring Nightreign, is set to launch on September 30 and preorders are available now for $45 at Amazon. This official 400-page hardcover strategy guide includes maps, a bestiary, item catalog, and explainers to help you master the multiplayer co-op spinoffs challenging run-based gameplay, plus printed compilations of dialogue, lore entries, artwork, and more.

The Elden Ring Nightreign Official Companion Guide follows up on the previous three-volume Elden Ring: Books of Knowledge strategy guide series from Future Press. Like the Nightreign strategy guide, the Books of Knowledge feature a hundreds of pages with gameplay tips, lore, and artwork, and each one focuses on a different aspect of the gamethe 512-page Volume 1 is all about the various locations; Volume 2 includes 528 pages on the combat system, enemies, spells, and equipment sets; and Volume 3 is a 416-page guide to Shadow of the Erdtree. All three volumes are currently in stock and available at Amazon--but it's worth grabbing these soon, as the first two volumes were sold out for over a year before Amazon restocked them in June.

Elden Ring: The Road to the Erdtree Manga

As if there wasn't already enough new Elden Ring reading material launching soon, the next volume of the official Elden Ring manga, The Road to the Erdtree, launches on October 28. You can preorder Volume 7 for $13 at Amazon. Volume 6 also just launched on July 22, and you can pick it up along with the rest of the other volumes so far at the links below.

While Elden Ring: The Road to the Erdtree captures to look of Elden Ring in its artstyle and features many of the memorable locations, monsters, and characters seen in the game, it's worth noting that it is a very different take on the source material. Instead of a grim and serious tale set in The Lands Between, The Road to Erdtree is a comedic adventure--though despite that shift in tone, it has been well-received by fans thanks to its strong writing. Check it out if you want to experience Elden Ring in a new way.

  • Volume 1 -- $11.70 ($13)
  • Volume 2 -- $11.70 ($13)
  • Volume 3 -- $10.30 ($13)
  • Volume 4 -- $10.30 ($13)
  • Volume 5 -- $10.30 ($13)
  • Volume 6 -- $13
  • Volume 7 -- $13 | Releases October 28
  • The Witcher 5-Novel Box Set On Sale For Just $33 At Amazon
  • Amazon Restocks The $40 Licensed Alternative To Switch 2 All-In-One Case
  • Nintendo Switch 2 At Amazon - Console Restocks, Every Accessory You Can Buy, And More
  • + Show More More Gaming, Tech, and Entertainment Deals & Preorders Links (5)
  • God Of War 20th Anniversary Retrospective Box Set Gets Nice Discount
  • Lord Of The Rings Tolkien Illustrated Book Is Only $30 At Amazon Right Now
  • Berserk's Best Anime Adaptation Gets Limited-Time Price Cut At Amazon
  • Happy Gilmore And Billy Madison 4K Blu-Ray Preorders Steeply Discounted At Amazon
  • 8BitDo's New $50 iPhone Controller Is Officially Licensed By Xbox

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Diablo Immortal Is Adding Hearthstone Cards In New Event (And Allegedly Using AI Art)
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Diablo Immortal is crossing over with Blizzard's own Hearthstone for a new event where players can wield the effects of some of the trading card game's most iconic cards, but many players are more focused on what they believe is AI art being used to promote the crossover.

The Hearthstone event in Diablo Immortal will run from July 30 to August 27, with players able to acquire 18 abilities based on Hearthstone cards like Polymorph, Ice Block, Windfury, Flame Imp, Holy Nova, and more. These cards activate new powers in Diablo Immortal's Enchanted Planes and Trial of the Hearth game modes. There is also a new Legendary gem, the Manaflux gem, that is inspired by Hearthstone's mana mechanic. It builds mana stacks over time, after which using a skill will play a Hearthstone card like Ragnaros or Acidic Swamp Ooze to decimate enemies.

While players who want to collect all the cards will need to purchase card packs, Blizzard is giving away some freebies in the form of a promo code (CARDCOLLECT) that can be used to acquire a random card and various other items like gems and crests. Players who login to Diablo Immortal with a character level 10 or higher during the event will also unlock an exclusive Hearthstone card back.

The event will additionally add new Warcraft-inspired pets like the Core Rager and Lil' Ragnaros, as well as character skins based on Azeroth's most famous power couple, Malfurion Stormrage and Tyrande Whisperwind. It's not the first time Diablo Immortal has crossed over with the Warcraft universe, with a previous crossover event adding the Lich King as a boss battle.

In the leadup to the event's launch, fans over on Reddit (via PC Gamer) noticed the piece of artwork teasing the Diablo Immortal and Hearthstone crossover looked off. That quickly led to accusations that Blizzard, or perhaps Diablo Immortal's co-developer NetEase, had used generative AI to create the artwork.

The artwork features a Night Elf (presumably Tyrande) sitting across a tavern table and playing cards, and there are some noticeable oddities. Tyrande's necklace appears to be somewhat melted, the Hearthstone cards look wrong, pieces of toast are just sitting on a table in an odd manner, and the human card player's ear is malformed.

Blizzard has not addressed the situation, but it's not the first time it's been accused of using AI art in Hearthstone. Last year the studio investigated claims that a batch of upcoming Hearthstone-hero skins were made using AI, and while Blizzard didn't confirm that they were, it did end up removing the skins in question.

Diablo Immortal recently added new spin on a classic Diablo class, the Druid. It's the third class to be added to the free-to-play mobile ARPG since launch, joining the vampiric Blood Knight and the water-bending Tempest.

For those diving in to Diablo Immortal's Hearthstone event, below is the full card list and their effects.

Diablo Immortal Hearthstone Cards

Mage

  • Polymorph (Common): You have a chance to transform nearby enemies into Yaks. Polymorphed enemies take increased damage.
  • Ice Block (Epic): Instead of dying, become immune to damage, heal yourself, and release a blast of ice, dealing damage to and freezing nearby enemies.

Warrior

  • Bash (Common): When you deal damage, create a damaging area and gain a shield that can resist damage for a few seconds.
  • Blade Storm (Epic): When you deal damage, a storm of blades surrounds you, dealing damage to nearby enemies and blocking projectiles.

Hunter

  • Explosive Trap (Common): When you take damage, an explosion occurs, causing damage to surrounding enemies.
  • Snake Trap (Rare): When you take damage, become immune and summon 3 Hellfire Deceivers that spit poison at nearby enemies.

Priest

  • Holy Nova (Common): When you take damage, you release a blast of light that knocks nearby enemies back, dealing damage and healing you.
  • Shadowform (Epic): You have a chance to enter Shadow Form, increasing your Primary Attack damage, and firing shadow projectiles that deal extra damage.

Warlock

  • Flame Imp (Common): You have a chance to summon an imp that throws a fireball at you and nearby enemies, dealing damage and applying Burn.
  • Defile (Rare): You have a chance to mark nearby enemies with Defile. Marked enemies are damaged, and if they die while marked, spread defile to other unmarked nearby enemies.

Shaman

  • Windfury (Common): You have a chance to gain Windfury, increasing your Primary Attack speed.
  • Lightning Storm (Epic): You have a chance to trigger a damaging lightning storm becoming Overloaded, reducing the cooldown all skills.

Paladin

  • Blessing of Wisdom (Common): You have a chance to gain Blessing of Wisdom during which Primary Attacks will reduce the cooldown of other card effects.
  • Lay on Hands (Epic): You have a chance to restore Life and refresh all skill cooldowns.

Druid

  • Swipe (Common): Your Primary Attack deals extra damage to the target enemy and damages other nearby enemies.
  • Ancient of Lore (Epic): When you take damage, heal, and reduce the cooldown of other cards.

Rogue

  • Backstab (Common): Deal extra damage to undamaged enemies.
  • Preparation (Epic): You have a chance to shorten the cooldowns of all your skills for a short period of time.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Wuchang: Fallen Feathers Developer Apologizes For Performance Issues, Outlines Plans For Fixes
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Wuchang: Fallen Feathers launched last week, and while it's done well with critics, it's sitting at a mixed rating on Steam. Why? According to a number of player reviews, optimization issues. Earlier today, however, developer Leenzee put out a response to the game's issues, where it spoke about what it plans to do to solve the game's current problems.

"First and foremost, we sincerely apologize for the inconvenience and appreciate everyone for their continued patience and understanding regarding the recent issues surrounding the launch of Wuchang: Fallen Feathers," wrote the developer. "Your experience and feedback is [a] valuable foundation for our team. We will provide a comprehensive explanation about the game content soon."

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

Now Playing: Wuchang: Fallen Feathers - Launch Trailer

One of the issues the game has experienced so far is related to preorder bonuses, as an update released on July 25 did not properly distribute these bonuses to all players. As compensation for this, those who own the deluxe-edition of the game on Steam will be getting three extra sets of deluxe costumes and four weapons, and both standard- and deluxe-edition owners will get three headgear items on all platforms.

In terms of the game's performance and optimization issues, Leenzee explained that it will "continue to optimize performance issues and will keep adjusting the game based on your suggestions--such as difficulty levels and boss encounters--in upcoming patches." It outlined a preview of some of its "recent optimization efforts," which include things like crash fixes, improved frame rates and reduced lag on certain graphics cards, improved AI logic for monsters and bosses, enhanced texture quality in low-resolution areas, and improved asset detail and precision in some regions.

Leenzee closed out the post by asking "for your patience as we tackle these optimizations step by step."

If you're curious as to whether the game is worth checking out despite these performance issues, check out or Wuchang: Fallen Feathers review.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/wuchang-fallen-feathers-developer-apologizes-for-performance-issues-outlines-plans-for-fixes/1100-6533486/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f
